segment.source: Modify GPO Filters to Apply to a Different Zone or Version of Windows (Windows 10)
segment.target: Modify GPO Filters to Apply to a Different Zone or Version of Windows (Windows 10)

segment.source: Modify GPO Filters to Apply to a Different Zone or Version of Windows
segment.target: Modify GPO Filters to Apply to a Different Zone or Version of Windows

segment.source: Modify GPO Filters to Apply to a Different Zone or Version of Windows
segment.target: Modify GPO Filters to Apply to a Different Zone or Version of Windows

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: You must reconfigure your copied GPO so that it contains the correct security group and WMI filters for its new role.
segment.target: You must reconfigure your copied GPO so that it contains the correct security group and WMI filters for its new role.

segment.source: If you are creating the GPO for the isolated domain, use the Block members of a group from applying a GPO procedure to prevent members of the boundary and encryption zones from incorrectly applying the GPOs for the main isolated domain.
segment.target: If you are creating the GPO for the isolated domain, use the Block members of a group from applying a GPO procedure to prevent members of the boundary and encryption zones from incorrectly applying the GPOs for the main isolated domain.

segment.source: Administrative credentials
segment.target: Administrative credentials

segment.source: To complete these procedures, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to modify the GPOs.
segment.target: To complete these procedures, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to modify the GPOs.

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: Change the security group filter for a GPO
segment.target: Change the security group filter for a GPO

segment.source: Block members of a group from applying a GPO
segment.target: Block members of a group from applying a GPO

segment.source: Remove a block for members of a group from applying a GPO
segment.target: Remove a block for members of a group from applying a GPO

segment.source: To change the security group filter for a GPO
segment.target: To change the security group filter for a GPO

segment.source: Open the Group Policy Management console.
segment.target: Open the Group Policy Management console.

segment.source: In the navigation pane, find and then click the GPO that you want to modify.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, find and then click the GPO that you want to modify.

segment.source: In the details pane, under Security Filtering, click the currently assigned security group, and then click Remove.
segment.target: In the details pane, under Security Filtering, click the currently assigned security group, and then click Remove.

segment.source: Now you can add the appropriate security group to this GPO.
segment.target: Now you can add the appropriate security group to this GPO.

segment.source: Under Security Filtering, click Add.
segment.target: Under Security Filtering, click Add.

segment.source: In the Select User, Computer, or Group dialog box, type the name of the group whose members are to apply the GPO, and then click OK.
segment.target: In the Select User, Computer, or Group dialog box, type the name of the group whose members are to apply the GPO, and then click OK.

segment.source: If you do not know the name, you can click Advanced to browse the list of groups available in the domain.
segment.target: If you do not know the name, you can click Advanced to browse the list of groups available in the domain.

segment.source: To block members of a group from applying a GPO
segment.target: To block members of a group from applying a GPO

segment.source: Open the Group Policy Management console.
segment.target: Open the Group Policy Management console.

segment.source: In the navigation pane, find and then click the GPO that you want to modify.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, find and then click the GPO that you want to modify.

segment.source: In the details pane, click the Delegation tab.
segment.target: In the details pane, click the Delegation tab.

segment.source: Click Advanced.
segment.target: Click Advanced.

segment.source: Under the Group or user names list, click Add.
segment.target: Under the Group or user names list, click Add.

segment.source: In the Select User, Computer, or Group dialog box, type the name of the group whose members are to be prevented from applying the GPO, and then click OK.
segment.target: In the Select User, Computer, or Group dialog box, type the name of the group whose members are to be prevented from applying the GPO, and then click OK.

segment.source: If you do not know the name, you can click Advanced to browse the list of groups available in the domain.
segment.target: If you do not know the name, you can click Advanced to browse the list of groups available in the domain.

segment.source: Select the group in the Group or user names list, and then select the boxes in the Deny column for both Read and Apply group policy.
segment.target: Select the group in the Group or user names list, and then select the boxes in the Deny column for both Read and Apply group policy.

segment.source: Click OK, and then in the Windows Security dialog box, click Yes.
segment.target: Click OK, and then in the Windows Security dialog box, click Yes.

segment.source: The group appears in the list with custom permissions.
segment.target: The group appears in the list with custom permissions.

segment.source: To remove a block for members of group from applying a GPO
segment.target: To remove a block for members of group from applying a GPO

segment.source: Open the Group Policy Management console.
segment.target: Open the Group Policy Management console.

segment.source: In the navigation pane, find and then click the GPO that you want to modify.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, find and then click the GPO that you want to modify.

segment.source: In the details pane, click the Delegation tab.
segment.target: In the details pane, click the Delegation tab.

segment.source: In the Groups and users list, select the group that should no longer be blocked, and then click Remove.
segment.target: In the Groups and users list, select the group that should no longer be blocked, and then click Remove.

segment.source: In the message box, click OK.
segment.target: In the message box, click OK.
